Package org.neo4j.internal.kernel.api

Interface SchemaRead

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SchemaReadCore
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AllStoreHolder, Read
    public interface SchemaRead
extends SchemaReadCore
    Surface for getting schema information, such as fetching specific indexes or constraints.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Checks if a constraint exists

      Get the owning constraint for a constraint index or null if the index does not have an owning constraint.

    • Method Detail

      • indexForSchemaNonTransactional

        Iterator<IndexDescriptor> indexForSchemaNonTransactional​(SchemaDescriptor schema)
        Acquire a reference to the index mapping the given schema, but without requiring a transaction to be open, and without taking any schema locks.
        Parameters:
        schema - The schema for which to look up an index.
        Returns:
        An index matching the schema, or IndexDescriptor.NO_INDEX if no such index was found or something went wrong.

      • indexUniqueValuesSelectivity

        double indexUniqueValuesSelectivity​(IndexDescriptor index)
                             throws IndexNotFoundKernelException
        Computes the selectivity of the unique values.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of interest
        Returns:
        The selectivity of the given index
        Throws:
        IndexNotFoundKernelException - if the index is not there

      • indexSize

        long indexSize​(IndexDescriptor index)
        throws IndexNotFoundKernelException
        Returns the size of the index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of interest
        Returns:
        The size of the current index
        Throws:
        IndexNotFoundKernelException - if the index is not there

      • nodesCountIndexed

        long nodesCountIndexed​(IndexDescriptor index,
                       long nodeId,
                       int propertyKeyId,
                       Value value)
                throws KernelException
        Count the number of index entries for the given nodeId and value.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of interest
        nodeId - node id to match.
        propertyKeyId - the indexed property to look at (composite indexes apply to more than one property, so we need to specify this)
        value - the property value
        Returns:
        number of index entries for the given nodeId and value.
        Throws:
        KernelException

      • indexSample

        IndexSample indexSample​(IndexDescriptor index)
                 throws IndexNotFoundKernelException
        Returns the index sample info.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of interest
        Returns:
        index sample info
        Throws:
        IndexNotFoundKernelException - if the index does not exist.

      • constraintsGetForSchema

        Iterator<ConstraintDescriptor> constraintsGetForSchema​(SchemaDescriptor descriptor)
        Finds all constraints for the given schema
        Parameters:
        descriptor - The descriptor of the schema
        Returns:
        All constraints for the given schema

      • constraintExists

        boolean constraintExists​(ConstraintDescriptor descriptor)
        Checks if a constraint exists
        Parameters:
        descriptor - The descriptor of the constraint to check.
        Returns:
        true if the constraint exists, otherwise false

      • snapshot

        SchemaReadCore snapshot()
        Produce a snapshot of the current schema, which can be accessed without acquiring any schema locks.

        This is useful for inspecting schema elements when you have no intention of updating the schema, and where waiting on schema locks from, for instance, constraint creating transactions, would be inconvenient.

        The snapshot observes transaction state of the current transaction.

      • indexGetOwningUniquenessConstraintId

        Long indexGetOwningUniquenessConstraintId​(IndexDescriptor index)
        Get the owning constraint for a constraint index or null if the index does not have an owning constraint.

      • schemaStateGetOrCreate

        <K,​V> V schemaStateGetOrCreate​(K key,
                                     Function<K,​V> creator)
        Returns schema state for the given key or create a new state if not there
        Type Parameters:
        K - type of the key
        V - type of the schema state value
        Parameters:
        key - The key to access
        creator - function creating schema state
        Returns:
        the state associated with the key or a new value if non-existing

        void schemaStateFlush()
        Flush the schema state
